summary: Roderick MacKinnon  is a professor of Molecular Neurobiology and Biophysics at Rockefeller University.
full_text: Roderick MacKinnon  is a professor of Molecular Neurobiology and Biophysics at Rockefeller University who won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry together with Peter Agre in 2003 for his work on the structure and operation of ion channels.
title: Roderick MacKinnon
